item.title: Do older players get evicted earlier in BigBrotherUS?
item.description: Visualize the spread of player ages across all seasons as a histogram Figure 1: Data plotted as the number of houseguets (y-axis) that fall in to each category. Each bar representes 2 years of age. The mean and median player ages are indicated by couloured vertical dashed lines. Key Insights: Visual inspection of the distribution of players indicates that most BBUS houseguests are in their mid-late 20’s during the filming of their seasons.

item.title: How long does the surviving week 1 nominee last in the game?
item.description: Each season, at least one player survives the block in the first week. We wondered how does being a surviving week 1 nominee affect game outcomes? Step 1: Graph how far each surviving first week nominee made in on their season of BBUS: Figure 1: Data plotted as each seasons first nominee (y-axis) with that players place on their season represented on the x-axis. Peach points(left) represent the starting humber of players on each season.

item.title: OTEV Analysis
item.description: Make Graph of which week OTEV was played in each season: Figure 1: Seasons of BBUS where OTEV was played (y-axis) plotted against which week in the season OTEV appeared (y-axis). Key Insights: Since it was first introduced during season 7, OTEV has been played every season except for season 10. Each season OTEV has appearead as a different wacky character, but the fundamentals of the game have remained consistent.

item.title: Is winning the first or second HOH competition advantageous in BBUS?
item.description: Question: Is winning the first HOH good or bad for players’ games? Players often mention that they don’t want to win the first HOH, as not to “put a target on their back”. Is there systematic evidence to support an effect of winning the first HOH on game outcomes?
